data.title: Make searching # symbols better
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6 Insider

Currently global symbols search isn't really a good experience, as user can't find anything without typing and then waiting for 3 seconds.

One improvement could be letting Cmd+T cache "recently jumped symbols" like Cmd+P does for "recently opened documents", and show it at Cmd+T even if no input is received yet.
Currently it's blank with no input:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4033249/19173046/0abaac2c-8bda-11e6-8a29-95551112e8e5.png)

Another idea is to fastly compute all symbols in all open files (or files that have been open since launching) and provide them as `#` symbols. Which would be much more useful than the current Cmd+T.

data.title: git hide left diff pane button

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body: (v1.5.3 osx) This is me checking my code ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/863731/19171397/c2c80250-8c1c-11e6-9f6b-558b03b0fdc5.png) And this is me developing :P ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/863731/19171369/a2d8f792-8c1c-11e6-9abc-b38cf63eb5d6.png) Am I the only one that ends up doing this? Yes I know there is a inline view and a ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/863731/19171317/575517f6-8c1c-11e6-90e5-58ef4da90119.png) go to file button, but thats not the same as I am doing :) Can you make a hide left diff pane button please? And by left I mean the left diff editor view not the git side bar :) Location and how the new icon button should look like is ofcourse open for discussion. EDIT: rjmunro pointed out that you can right click and do `open change` in the sidebar so no extra button needed, but there is no diff highlighting when you do that so that still needs to be implemented.

data.title: Enable git.confirmSync by default (fixes #8655)
Using capslock in a keybinding still toggles capslock

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3 (also tried with today's 1.6.0-insider build)
- OS Version: Win 10
## Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open the keybinding preferences
2. Map the capslock key to a command (e.g. `{"key": "capslock", "command": "workbench.action.showCommands"}`
3. While editing, using capslock to trigger the command, and observe that it fires.
4. Continue typing in the editor and observe capslock is now on.
## Expected

Capslock should not be passed through and toggle caps-lock in the editor if it is mapped to a command. (Capslock is often mapped to exiting Insert mode in Vim setups, as it's far closer than the Escape key).

See also related https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/issues/854 .

data.title: Indentation affects which blocks are collapsible
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

I'm not sure if this a bug or not, but I just noticed that indentation/spacing has an affect on which blocks of code are collapsible. 

As it is right now, anything that is indented past the first line of a block will be considered as being part of that block. This makes sense for a language where indentation determines context (Python), but in languages with explicitly defined blocks (JavaScript in this case) I'd expect the collapsible regions to be aware of the defined block.

**Examples:**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3431954/19168061/027d1136-8bd4-11e6-8247-e1141bde7773.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3431954/19168063/04b9ab8a-8bd4-11e6-9947-a8d505ff92ad.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3431954/19168305/33b2290c-8bd5-11e6-94ce-3b0fdec968ad.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3431954/19168310/36c59ef8-8bd5-11e6-8cb7-f8c3312945cb.png)

data.title: Hot Exit: Support multiple folder restore

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Prerequisite: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/101

When exiting all windows via File > Exit (Windows/Linux), Code > Quit Code (Mac), the normal rules of last window open should not apply (this happens on this event `app.on('before-quit`)`). All backups should be retained and restored on next launch.

On Mac the close last window instance hot exit rule should not happen due to the application sticking around.

data.title: infinity symbol in .less comments caused a crash, and now shows warnings
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.5.3 (5be4091987a98e3870d89d630eb87be6d9bafd27, 2016-09-22T08:50:42.185Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Include an infiniti symbol (value #x221e) in a block comment (.less file)
2. Try to tab the line over
3. Visual Studio Code process crashes (happened once, not repeatable by myself) OR Visual Studio Code gives the Warning "CSS parsing error at line __, char __: Unrecognized character "

Since I have not yet had a problem with unicode symbols within .less comment blocks during compiling, it seems like the IDE should just ignore the odd unicode symbol within comments.

![screenshot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17821843/19162831/579ca788-8bae-11e6-8062-fe6fb934a29d.png)

data.title: Extension update visible but not installable due to `engines`
data.body: - VSCode Version: 1.5.3 - OS Version: macOS sierra Steps to Reproduce: 1. Install the [final-newline](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=samverschueren.final-newline) extension in VS Code 1.5.3 (this is important!) 2. It will install `final-newline@0.2.0` because that one was target to [0.10.x](https://github.com/SamVerschueren/vscode-final-newline/blob/v0.2.0/package.json#L7) 3. Enable the extension and search again for the `final-newline` extension in the extension list. It will show that their is an update available, namely `0.3.0`, but that version is targetted to [^1.6.x](https://github.com/SamVerschueren/vscode-final-newline/blob/master/package.json#L7) 4. You can try to install the plugin, which looks like it succeeds, but when restarting VS Code, it will again show up as update. Extension list should show `0.2.0` as `0.3.0` is not supported by VS Code 1.5.3 After installing the extension and enabling it, this is what shows up in the extension list So it succesfully installs the correct version, only the notification shouldn't be showing. FYI @joaomoreno

data.title: Debug actions should be included in `terminal.integrated.commandsToSkipShell`
data.body:
Like adding 

```
    "workbench.action.debug.start",
    "workbench.action.debug.continue"
```

AFAIK F keys aren't used in terminal input.

data.title: MYVAR should trigger autocomplete for MY_VARIABLE
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.0 Insider
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

While `MY_VAR` triggers autocomplete for `MY_VARIABLE`, `MYVAR` doesn't.

This is an inconsistency as `myvar` triggers `my_variable`, and `webkita` triggers `-webkit-animation`.

data.title: Changing selected launch configuration is not regarded when application is already running
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have more than one launch configuration ('Config A', 'Config B')
2. Start application debug/run with 'Config A'
3. Change launch configuration to 'Config B' while application is still running under config A
4. Stop application via stop button
5. (Drop down sais 'Config B')
6. Start debugging
7. 'Config A' is started and drop down changes to 'Config A'
8. Expected behaviour: 'Config B' is started

data.title: Brace matching for angle brackets gives wrong match
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 10 Enterprise version 1607

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a new file.
2. Set the language to TypeScript (in the lower-right corner).
3. Type `const x: Array<() => void> = []`.
4. Place your cursor at the end of `Array`.
5. The `>` at the end of `=>` is highlighted. I would expect the `>` at the end of `void>`.

This does not appear to be a problem with the TypeScript language service; see Microsoft/TypeScript#11389.

data.title: [enhancement] Be able to set extension loading order
data.body:
I (and I'm sure many others) have a fair few extensions. My vim emulation extension loads last, as the author's name starts with a V. I have about 30 seconds before this one can launch.

Instead of loading alphabetically, it would be awesome if we could set load order, or at least set one or two to be priority loaded (in a json file or an ini).

I tried renaming the folder to have AAA at the beginning, VSC doesn't update it then (as expected).

data.title: Unable to open VS Code 1.5 with "-g" option on Windows
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.5.3
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run: Code.exe -r -g "C:\Users\Lukasz\Desktop\Projects\Shooter\Assets\Done\Done_Scripts\Done_BGScroller.cs":1
2. Notice error message and that VS Code window does not show.
   `Arguments in``--goto``mode should be in the format of``FILE(:LINE(:COLUMN))``.`

Also does not work without quotes around filename.

This worked correctly in VS Code 1.4. This is blocking Unity 5.5 from opening VS Code 1.5 on Windows.
